metadata.title: CVE-2024-26890 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: btrtl: fix out of bounds memory access The problem is detectedby KASAN. btrtl driver uses private hci data to store 'structbtrealtek_data'. If btrtl driver is used with btusb, then memory forprivate hci data is allocated in btusb. But no private data is allocatedafter hci_dev, when btrtl is used with hci_h5. This commit adds memoryallocation for hci_h5 case.================================================================== BUG:KASAN: slab-out-of-bounds in btrtl_initialize+0x6cc/0x958 [btrtl] Write ofsize 8 at addr ffff00000f5a5748 by task kworker/u9:0/76 Hardware name:Pine64 PinePhone (1.2) (DT) Workqueue: hci0 hci_power_on [bluetooth] Calltrace: dump_backtrace+0x9c/0x128
